\hypertarget{creating-an-ai-enhanced-pattern-matcher}{%
\subsection{Creating an AI-Enhanced Pattern
Matcher}\label{creating-an-ai-enhanced-pattern-matcher}}

Use AI to help design a more sophisticated pattern matching system:

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ re}

\KeywordTok{class}\NormalTok{ PatternMatcher:}
    \CommentTok{"""}
\CommentTok{    Advanced pattern matcher for chatbot responses.}
\CommentTok{    This class was designed with assistance from an AI programming assistant}
\CommentTok{    to improve response accuracy.}
\CommentTok{    """}

    \KeywordTok{def} \FunctionTok{\_\_init\_\_}\NormalTok{(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{\# Define regex patterns for common user intents}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.patterns }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ \{}
            \StringTok{"greeting"}\NormalTok{: re.}\BuiltInTok{compile}\NormalTok{(}\VerbatimStringTok{r\textquotesingle{}\textbackslash{}b(hello|hi|hey|greetings|howdy)\textbackslash{}b\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{, re.IGNORECASE),}
            \StringTok{"farewell"}\NormalTok{: re.}\BuiltInTok{compile}\NormalTok{(}\VerbatimStringTok{r\textquotesingle{}\textbackslash{}b(bye|goodbye|see\textbackslash{}s+you|farewell|exit|quit)\textbackslash{}b\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{, re.IGNORECASE),}
            \StringTok{"gratitude"}\NormalTok{: re.}\BuiltInTok{compile}\NormalTok{(}\VerbatimStringTok{r\textquotesingle{}\textbackslash{}b(thanks|thank\textbackslash{}s+you|appreciate)\textbackslash{}b\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{, re.IGNORECASE),}
            \StringTok{"help"}\NormalTok{: re.}\BuiltInTok{compile}\NormalTok{(}\VerbatimStringTok{r\textquotesingle{}\textbackslash{}b(help|assist|support|guide)\textbackslash{}b\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{, re.IGNORECASE),}
            \StringTok{"information"}\NormalTok{: re.}\BuiltInTok{compile}\NormalTok{(}\VerbatimStringTok{r\textquotesingle{}\textbackslash{}b(what|how|why|when|where|who|tell\textbackslash{}s+me|info)\textbackslash{}b\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{, re.IGNORECASE)}
\NormalTok{        \}}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ identify\_intent(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, user\_input):}
        \CommentTok{"""}
\CommentTok{        Identify the primary intent from user input.}

\CommentTok{        Args:}
\CommentTok{            user\_input (str): The user\textquotesingle{}s message}

\CommentTok{        Returns:}
\CommentTok{            str: The identified intent or "unknown"}
\CommentTok{        """}
        \ControlFlowTok{for}\NormalTok{ intent, pattern }\KeywordTok{in} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.patterns.items():}
            \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ pattern.search(user\_input):}
                \ControlFlowTok{return}\NormalTok{ intent}

        \ControlFlowTok{return} \StringTok{"unknown"}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ extract\_entities(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, user\_input):}
        \CommentTok{"""}
\CommentTok{        Extract key entities from user input (names, dates, etc.).}

\CommentTok{        Args:}
\CommentTok{            user\_input (str): The user\textquotesingle{}s message}

\CommentTok{        Returns:}
\CommentTok{            dict: Extracted entities by type}
\CommentTok{        """}
\NormalTok{        entities }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ \{\}}

        \CommentTok{\# Find names (simplistic approach)}
\NormalTok{        name\_match }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ re.search(}\VerbatimStringTok{r\textquotesingle{}my name is (\textbackslash{}w+)\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{, user\_input, re.IGNORECASE)}
        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ name\_match:}
\NormalTok{            entities[}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}name\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{] }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ name\_match.group(}\DecValTok{1}\NormalTok{)}

        \CommentTok{\# Find dates (simplistic approach)}
\NormalTok{        date\_match }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ re.search(}\VerbatimStringTok{r\textquotesingle{}(today|tomorrow|yesterday|\textbackslash{}d\{1,2\}/\textbackslash{}d\{1,2\}(?:/\textbackslash{}d\{2,4\})?)\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{, user\_input, re.IGNORECASE)}
        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ date\_match:}
\NormalTok{            entities[}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}date\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{] }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ date\_match.group(}\DecValTok{1}\NormalTok{)}

        \ControlFlowTok{return}\NormalTok{ entities}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\hypertarget{adding-ai-generated-response-variety}{%
\subsection{Adding AI-Generated Response
Variety}\label{adding-ai-generated-response-variety}}

Use AI to generate code that adds variety to your chatbot's responses:

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ random}

\KeywordTok{class}\NormalTok{ ResponseGenerator:}
    \CommentTok{"""}
\CommentTok{    Generates varied responses based on templates and context.}
\CommentTok{    Uses techniques inspired by AI assistants to create more natural dialogue.}
\CommentTok{    """}

    \KeywordTok{def} \FunctionTok{\_\_init\_\_}\NormalTok{(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, templates):}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.templates }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ templates}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.last\_used }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ \{\}  }\CommentTok{\# Track last used response for each category}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.conversation\_context }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ []  }\CommentTok{\# Track conversation history}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ generate\_response(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, intent, entities}\OperatorTok{=}\VariableTok{None}\NormalTok{, user\_name}\OperatorTok{=}\VariableTok{None}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{"""}
\CommentTok{        Generate a response based on intent, entities, and conversation context.}

\CommentTok{        Args:}
\CommentTok{            intent (str): The identified user intent}
\CommentTok{            entities (dict, optional): Extracted entities from user input}
\CommentTok{            user\_name (str, optional): The user\textquotesingle{}s name if known}

\CommentTok{        Returns:}
\CommentTok{            str: A response appropriate to the context}
\CommentTok{        """}
        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ intent }\KeywordTok{not} \KeywordTok{in} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.templates:}
\NormalTok{            intent }\OperatorTok{=} \StringTok{"unknown"}

        \CommentTok{\# Get available templates for this intent}
\NormalTok{        available\_templates }\OperatorTok{=} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.templates[intent]}

        \CommentTok{\# Avoid repeating the last response}
        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ intent }\KeywordTok{in} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.last\_used }\KeywordTok{and} \BuiltInTok{len}\NormalTok{(available\_templates) }\OperatorTok{\textgreater{}} \DecValTok{1}\NormalTok{:}
\NormalTok{            available\_templates }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ [t }\ControlFlowTok{for}\NormalTok{ t }\KeywordTok{in}\NormalTok{ available\_templates }\ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ t }\OperatorTok{!=} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.last\_used[intent]]}

        \CommentTok{\# Select a template}
\NormalTok{        template }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ random.choice(available\_templates)}

        \CommentTok{\# Format the template with entities and user name}
        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ entities }\KeywordTok{is} \VariableTok{None}\NormalTok{:}
\NormalTok{            entities }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ \{\}}

        \CommentTok{\# Add user name to entities if provided}
        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ user\_name:}
\NormalTok{            entities[}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}user\_name\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{] }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ user\_name}

        \CommentTok{\# Format template with entities}
        \ControlFlowTok{for}\NormalTok{ key, value }\KeywordTok{in}\NormalTok{ entities.items():}
\NormalTok{            placeholder }\OperatorTok{=} \StringTok{\textquotesingle{}\{\textquotesingle{}} \OperatorTok{+}\NormalTok{ key }\OperatorTok{+} \StringTok{\textquotesingle{}\}\textquotesingle{}}
            \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ placeholder }\KeywordTok{in}\NormalTok{ template:}
\NormalTok{                template }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ template.replace(placeholder, value)}

        \CommentTok{\# Remember this response to avoid repetition}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.last\_used[intent] }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ template}

        \CommentTok{\# Add to conversation context}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.conversation\_context.append((intent, template))}
        \ControlFlowTok{if} \BuiltInTok{len}\NormalTok{(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.conversation\_context) }\OperatorTok{\textgreater{}} \DecValTok{10}\NormalTok{:}
            \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.conversation\_context.pop(}\DecValTok{0}\NormalTok{)  }\CommentTok{\# Keep only recent history}

        \ControlFlowTok{return}\NormalTok{ template}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

### Implementing AI-Suggested Improvements

After working on your chatbot for a while, you might ask an AI assistant to suggest improvements. Here's an example of implementing such suggestions:

```python
# Original simple chatbot implementation
class SimpleBot:
    def __init__(self, name):
        self.name = name
        self.responses = {
            "hello": "Hi there!",
            "how are you": "I'm good, thanks!",
            "bye": "Goodbye!"
        }

    def get_response(self, message):
        for key, response in self.responses.items():
            if key in message.lower():
                return response
        return "I don't understand."

# AI-suggested improved version
class EnhancedBot:
    def __init__(self, name):
        self.name = name
        self.user_name = None
        self.conversation_start = datetime.now()
        self.message_count = 0
        self.responses = {
            "greeting": ["Hi there!", "Hello!", "Greetings!"],
            "farewell": ["Goodbye!", "See you later!", "Bye for now!"],
            "inquiry": ["I'm just a chatbot.", "I'm doing well!", "I exist to chat!"],
            "default": ["I don't understand.", "Could you rephrase that?", "I'm not sure what you mean."]
        }
        self.patterns = {
            "greeting": ["hello", "hi", "hey", "greetings"],
            "farewell": ["bye", "goodbye", "see you", "farewell"],
            "inquiry": ["how are you", "what are you", "who are you"]
        }
        self.conversation_history = []

    def get_response(self, message):
        self.message_count += 1
        self.conversation_history.append(f"User: {message}")

        # Extract user name if not already known
        if self.user_name is None and "my name is" in message.lower():
            name_match = re.search(r'my name is (\w+)', message, re.IGNORECASE)
            if name_match:
                self.user_name = name_match.group(1)
                response = f"Nice to meet you, {self.user_name}!"
                self.conversation_history.append(f"{self.name}: {response}")
                return response

        # Match patterns
        for category, patterns in self.patterns.items():
            for pattern in patterns:
                if pattern in message.lower():
                    response = random.choice(self.responses[category])

                    # Personalize if user name is known
                    if self.user_name and category == "greeting":
                        response = response.replace("!", f", {self.user_name}!")

                    self.conversation_history.append(f"{self.name}: {response}")
                    return response

        # Default response
        response = random.choice(self.responses["default"])
        self.conversation_history.append(f"{self.name}: {response}")
        return response
\end{verbatim}

\hypertarget{developing-a-balanced-approach-to-ai-assistance}{%
\section{10. Developing a Balanced Approach to AI
Assistance}\label{developing-a-balanced-approach-to-ai-assistance}}

As you continue your Python journey, developing a balanced approach to
using AI programming assistants will be crucial. Here are some
guidelines for sustainable, effective use:

\hypertarget{the-learning-path}{%
\subsection{The Learning Path}\label{the-learning-path}}

When using AI assistants for learning Python:

\begin{enumerate}
\def\labelenumi{\arabic{enumi}.}
\tightlist
\item
  \textbf{Start with concepts}: First understand the fundamental
  concepts without AI
\item
  \textbf{Use AI for exploration}: Once you grasp basics, use AI to
  explore variations
\item
  \textbf{Challenge yourself}: Try solving problems before asking AI
\item
  \textbf{Deconstruct AI solutions}: When AI generates code, understand
  each line
\item
  \textbf{Build your mental model}: Use AI to fill gaps in your
  knowledge, not replace it
\end{enumerate}

\hypertarget{for-professional-development}{%
\subsection{For Professional
Development}\label{for-professional-development}}

When using AI in professional Python work:

\begin{enumerate}
\def\labelenumi{\arabic{enumi}.}
\tightlist
\item
  \textbf{Focus on high-level thinking}: Let AI handle routine tasks
  while you focus on architecture and design
\item
  \textbf{Verify critical components}: Double-check important functions,
  especially those affecting security or core logic
\item
  \textbf{Document AI usage}: Note where and how AI assistance was used
\item
  \textbf{Learn from AI suggestions}: Study AI-generated solutions to
  improve your own skills
\item
  \textbf{Maintain code ownership}: Ensure you fully understand all code
  in your project, even if AI-assisted
\end{enumerate}

\hypertarget{future-proof-skills}{%
\subsection{Future-Proof Skills}\label{future-proof-skills}}

As AI tools become more powerful, focus on skills that complement them:

\begin{enumerate}
\def\labelenumi{\arabic{enumi}.}
\tightlist
\item
  \textbf{Problem formulation}: Clearly defining requirements (good
  prompts)
\item
  \textbf{Code evaluation}: Critically assessing generated solutions
\item
  \textbf{System architecture}: High-level design thinking
\item
  \textbf{Debugging complex systems}: Identifying root causes across
  components
\item
  \textbf{Communication and collaboration}: Working effectively with
  others
\item
  \textbf{Ethical judgment}: Making appropriate decisions about AI usage
\end{enumerate}

\hypertarget{cross-references-22}{%
\section{Cross-References}\label{cross-references-22}}

\begin{itemize}
\tightlist
\item
  Previous Chapter:
  \protect\hyperlink{help-headquarters-finding-answers-when-you-get-stuck}{Getting

\textbf{\emph{AI Tip: When you need a complex functionality for your
Python project, consider using AI tools in a ``scaffolding'' capacity -
have the AI create the initial structure and key functions, then fill in
the implementation details yourself. This hybrid approach leverages AI
efficiency while ensuring you understand every part of your code.}}

\hypertarget{summary-13}{%
\section{Summary}\label{summary-13}}

AI programming assistants are transforming how we learn and use Python,
offering powerful capabilities that can accelerate development and
enhance learning. By understanding how to use these tools effectively -
crafting good prompts, critically evaluating generated code, and
maintaining a balance between AI assistance and personal skill
development - you can leverage AI to become a more effective Python
programmer.

Key takeaways from this chapter include:

\begin{itemize}
\tightlist
\item
  AI programming assistants excel at tasks like generating boilerplate
  code, explaining concepts, and suggesting improvements
\item
  The quality of AI assistance depends greatly on how well you
  communicate your needs
\item
  Always critically evaluate AI-generated code for correctness,
  efficiency, and security
\item
  Use AI tools to enhance your learning process, not replace it
\item
  Focus on developing high-level skills that complement AI capabilities
\end{itemize}

As AI tools continue to evolve, the ability to work effectively with
them will become an increasingly valuable skill for Python developers at
all levels. By developing a thoughtful, balanced approach to using these
tools, you can harness their power while continuing to grow your own
programming abilities.

\hypertarget{introduction-connecting-python-to-ai-capabilities}{%
\section{1. Introduction: Connecting Python to AI
Capabilities}\label{introduction-connecting-python-to-ai-capabilities}}

While Python itself is a powerful programming language, it becomes even
more powerful when connected to external AI services. Modern AI
capabilities like natural language understanding, image recognition, and
text generation are now accessible through simple API calls, allowing
Python developers to create increasingly intelligent applications
without needing to train their own AI models.

This chapter explores how to integrate these AI capabilities into your
Python applications. We'll focus on practical integration patterns
rather than the theory behind AI models, giving you the tools to enhance
your projects with AI features regardless of your background in machine
learning.

The skills you'll learn in this chapter represent a significant trend in
modern programming: the ability to compose applications by connecting to
specialized AI services rather than building everything from scratch.
This approach lets you leverage cutting-edge AI research in your
projects without requiring expertise in data science or machine
learning.

\textbf{\emph{AI Tip: When integrating AI services into your Python
applications, always start with a minimal proof-of-concept to test the
API connection and response format before building more complex
features. This helps identify integration issues early and ensures you
understand the service's capabilities and limitations.}}

\hypertarget{the-ai-integration-landscape}{%
\section{2. The AI Integration
Landscape}\label{the-ai-integration-landscape}}

The AI services landscape offers a variety of options for Python
developers, ranging from general-purpose AI platforms to specialized
services for specific tasks.

\hypertarget{types-of-ai-services}{%
\subsection{Types of AI Services}\label{types-of-ai-services}}

\begin{enumerate}
\def\labelenumi{\arabic{enumi}.}
\tightlist
\item
  \textbf{Large Language Models (LLMs)}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Services like OpenAI's GPT models, Anthropic's Claude, or Google's
    Gemini
  \item
    Capabilities include text generation, summarization, translation,
    and question answering
  \item
    Access through REST APIs with API key authentication
  \end{itemize}
\item
  \textbf{Vision AI Services}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Image classification, object detection, OCR (Optical Character
    Recognition)
  \item
    Available through Google Cloud Vision, Azure Computer Vision, AWS
    Rekognition
  \item
    Typically requires sending image data and receiving structured
    analysis
  \end{itemize}
\item
  \textbf{Speech and Audio Services}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Speech-to-text, text-to-speech, audio analysis
  \item
    Google Cloud Speech, Amazon Transcribe, Azure Speech Services
  \item
    Often involves streaming audio or uploading audio files
  \end{itemize}
\item
  \textbf{Specialized NLP Services}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Sentiment analysis, named entity recognition, language detection
  \item
    Available through various providers or as standalone APIs
  \item
    Usually takes text input and returns structured analysis
  \end{itemize}
\item
  \textbf{Multi-modal Services}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Combining text, image, audio in a single API
  \item
    Examples include OpenAI's GPT-4 Vision, Google's Gemini, Anthropic's
    Claude Opus
  \item
    Allows for more complex interactions like ``describe this image'' or
    ``create an image based on this text''
  \end{itemize}
\end{enumerate}

\hypertarget{integration-models}{%
\subsection{Integration Models}\label{integration-models}}

When integrating AI services, you'll generally use one of these
patterns:

\begin{enumerate}
\def\labelenumi{\arabic{enumi}.}
\tightlist
\item
  \textbf{REST API Integration}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Making HTTP requests to AI service endpoints
  \item
    Sending data in JSON format and processing JSON responses
  \item
    Managing authentication through API keys or OAuth tokens
  \end{itemize}
\item
  \textbf{SDK-based Integration}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Using official Python libraries provided by AI service vendors
  \item
    Typically wraps the REST API with Python-friendly interfaces
  \item
    Often handles authentication and request formatting
  \end{itemize}
\item
  \textbf{Library-based Integration}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Using third-party Python libraries that abstract away the API
    details
  \item
    May provide higher-level functionality or combine multiple services
  \item
    Examples include LangChain, LlamaIndex, and similar frameworks
  \end{itemize}
\item
  \textbf{Self-hosted Models}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Running open-source AI models directly in your application
  \item
    Libraries like Hugging Face's Transformers make this possible
  \item
    Requires more computational resources but reduces API costs and
    latency
  \end{itemize}
\end{enumerate}

\hypertarget{getting-started-with-ai-api-integration}{%
\section{3. Getting Started with AI API
Integration}\label{getting-started-with-ai-api-integration}}

Let's start with the most common integration pattern: connecting to an
AI service via REST API.

\hypertarget{basic-api-integration-pattern}{%
\subsection{Basic API Integration
Pattern}\label{basic-api-integration-pattern}}

Most AI API integrations follow a similar pattern:

\begin{enumerate}
\def\labelenumi{\arabic{enumi}.}
\tightlist
\item
  Sign up for the service and obtain API credentials
\item
  Install the necessary Python packages (\texttt{requests} at minimum)
\item
  Prepare your data for the API request
\item
  Make the API call
\item
  Process and use the response
\end{enumerate}

\hypertarget{example-text-generation-with-openai}{%
\subsection{Example: Text Generation with
OpenAI}\label{example-text-generation-with-openai}}

Here's a basic example of integrating with OpenAI's API:

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ os}
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ requests}
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ json}

\KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ generate\_text(prompt, api\_key}\OperatorTok{=}\VariableTok{None}\NormalTok{):}
    \CommentTok{"""}
\CommentTok{    Generate text using OpenAI\textquotesingle{}s API.}

\CommentTok{    Args:}
\CommentTok{        prompt (str): The text prompt to send to the API}
\CommentTok{        api\_key (str, optional): OpenAI API key. If None, uses environment variable.}

\CommentTok{    Returns:}
\CommentTok{        str: The generated text response}
\CommentTok{    """}
    \CommentTok{\# Get API key from environment variable if not provided}
    \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ api\_key }\KeywordTok{is} \VariableTok{None}\NormalTok{:}
\NormalTok{        api\_key }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ os.environ.get(}\StringTok{"OPENAI\_API\_KEY"}\NormalTok{)}
        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ api\_key }\KeywordTok{is} \VariableTok{None}\NormalTok{:}
            \ControlFlowTok{raise} \PreprocessorTok{ValueError}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"API key must be provided or set as OPENAI\_API\_KEY environment variable"}\NormalTok{)}

    \CommentTok{\# API endpoint}
\NormalTok{    url }\OperatorTok{=} \StringTok{"https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions"}

    \CommentTok{\# Prepare the request payload}
\NormalTok{    payload }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ \{}
        \StringTok{"model"}\NormalTok{: }\StringTok{"gpt{-}3.5{-}turbo"}\NormalTok{,}
        \StringTok{"messages"}\NormalTok{: [\{}\StringTok{"role"}\NormalTok{: }\StringTok{"user"}\NormalTok{, }\StringTok{"content"}\NormalTok{: prompt\}],}
        \StringTok{"temperature"}\NormalTok{: }\FloatTok{0.7}\NormalTok{,}
        \StringTok{"max\_tokens"}\NormalTok{: }\DecValTok{150}
\NormalTok{    \}}

    \CommentTok{\# Prepare headers with authentication}
\NormalTok{    headers }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ \{}
        \StringTok{"Content{-}Type"}\NormalTok{: }\StringTok{"application/json"}\NormalTok{,}
        \StringTok{"Authorization"}\NormalTok{: }\SpecialStringTok{f"Bearer }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{api\_key}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}
\NormalTok{    \}}

    \CommentTok{\# Make the API request}
    \ControlFlowTok{try}\NormalTok{:}
\NormalTok{        response }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ requests.post(url, headers}\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{headers, data}\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{json.dumps(payload))}
\NormalTok{        response.raise\_for\_status()  }\CommentTok{\# Raise exception for HTTP errors}

        \CommentTok{\# Parse the response}
\NormalTok{        response\_data }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ response.json()}

        \CommentTok{\# Extract the generated text}
\NormalTok{        generated\_text }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ response\_data[}\StringTok{"choices"}\NormalTok{][}\DecValTok{0}\NormalTok{][}\StringTok{"message"}\NormalTok{][}\StringTok{"content"}\NormalTok{]}
        \ControlFlowTok{return}\NormalTok{ generated\_text.strip()}

    \ControlFlowTok{except}\NormalTok{ requests.exceptions.RequestException }\ImportTok{as}\NormalTok{ e:}
        \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"Error calling OpenAI API: }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{e}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}\NormalTok{)}
        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ response }\KeywordTok{and}\NormalTok{ response.text:}
            \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"Response: }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{response}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{text}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}\NormalTok{)}
        \ControlFlowTok{return} \VariableTok{None}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\subsection{Example: Image Analysis with Azure Computer

Here's how you might integrate with Microsoft Azure's Computer Vision

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ os}
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ requests}
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ json}

\KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ analyze\_image(image\_url, api\_key}\OperatorTok{=}\VariableTok{None}\NormalTok{, endpoint}\OperatorTok{=}\VariableTok{None}\NormalTok{):}

\CommentTok{        endpoint (str, optional): Azure endpoint. If None, uses environment variable.}

\CommentTok{    Returns:}
\CommentTok{        dict: The analysis results}
\CommentTok{    """}
    \CommentTok{\# Get credentials from environment variables if not provided}

\NormalTok{        api\_key }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ os.environ.get(}\StringTok{"AZURE\_VISION\_API\_KEY"}\NormalTok{)}
        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ api\_key }\KeywordTok{is} \VariableTok{None}\NormalTok{:}

    \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ endpoint }\KeywordTok{is} \VariableTok{None}\NormalTok{:}
\NormalTok{        endpoint }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ os.environ.get(}\StringTok{"AZURE\_VISION\_ENDPOINT"}\NormalTok{)}
        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ endpoint }\KeywordTok{is} \VariableTok{None}\NormalTok{:}
            \ControlFlowTok{raise} \PreprocessorTok{ValueError}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"Endpoint must be provided or set as AZURE\_VISION\_ENDPOINT environment variable"}\NormalTok{)}

    \CommentTok{\# API URL}
\NormalTok{    vision\_url }\OperatorTok{=} \SpecialStringTok{f"}\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{endpoint}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{/vision/v3.2/analyze"}

    \CommentTok{\# Parameters}

\NormalTok{    \}}

        \StringTok{"Ocp{-}Apim{-}Subscription{-}Key"}\NormalTok{: api\_key}
\NormalTok{    \}}

\NormalTok{    \}}

\NormalTok{        response }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ requests.post(vision\_url, headers}\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{headers, params}\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{params, json}\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{body)}
\NormalTok{        response.raise\_for\_status()}

        \CommentTok{\# Return the analysis results}
        \ControlFlowTok{return}\NormalTok{ response.json()}

    \ControlFlowTok{except}\NormalTok{ requests.exceptions.RequestException }\ImportTok{as}\NormalTok{ e:}

        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ response }\KeywordTok{and}\NormalTok{ response.text:}
            \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"Response: }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{response}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{text}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}\NormalTok{)}

management securely - Test and troubleshoot common AI integration issues

\hypertarget{introduction-connecting-python-to-ai-capabilities-1}{%
\section{1. Introduction: Connecting Python to AI
Capabilities}\label{introduction-connecting-python-to-ai-capabilities-1}}

While Python itself is a powerful programming language, it becomes even
more powerful when connected to external AI services. Modern AI
capabilities like natural language understanding, image recognition, and
text generation are now accessible through simple API calls, allowing
Python developers to create increasingly intelligent applications
without needing to train their own AI models.

This chapter explores how to integrate these AI capabilities into your
Python applications. We'll focus on practical integration patterns
rather than the theory behind AI models, giving you the tools to enhance
your projects with AI features regardless of your background in machine
learning.

The skills you'll learn in this chapter represent a significant trend in
modern programming: the ability to compose applications by connecting to
specialized AI services rather than building everything from scratch.
This approach lets you leverage cutting-edge AI research in your
projects without requiring expertise in data science or machine
learning.

\textbf{\emph{AI Tip: When integrating AI services into your Python
applications, always start with a minimal proof-of-concept to test the
API connection and response format before building more complex
features. This helps identify integration issues early and ensures you
understand the service's capabilities and limitations.}}

\hypertarget{the-ai-integration-landscape-1}{%
\section{2. The AI Integration
Landscape}\label{the-ai-integration-landscape-1}}

The AI services landscape offers a variety of options for Python
developers, ranging from general-purpose AI platforms to specialized
services for specific tasks.

\hypertarget{types-of-ai-services-1}{%
\subsection{Types of AI Services}\label{types-of-ai-services-1}}

\begin{enumerate}
\def\labelenumi{\arabic{enumi}.}
\tightlist
\item
  \textbf{Large Language Models (LLMs)}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Services like OpenAI's GPT models, Anthropic's Claude, or Google's
    Gemini
  \item
    Capabilities include text generation, summarization, translation,
    and question answering
  \item
    Access through REST APIs with API key authentication
  \end{itemize}
\item
  \textbf{Vision AI Services}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Image classification, object detection, OCR (Optical Character
    Recognition)
  \item
    Available through Google Cloud Vision, Azure Computer Vision, AWS
    Rekognition
  \item
    Typically requires sending image data and receiving structured
    analysis
  \end{itemize}
\item
  \textbf{Speech and Audio Services}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Speech-to-text, text-to-speech, audio analysis
  \item
    Google Cloud Speech, Amazon Transcribe, Azure Speech Services
  \item
    Often involves streaming audio or uploading audio files
  \end{itemize}
\item
  \textbf{Specialized NLP Services}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Sentiment analysis, named entity recognition, language detection
  \item
    Available through various providers or as standalone APIs
  \item
    Usually takes text input and returns structured analysis
  \end{itemize}
\item
  \textbf{Multi-modal Services}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Combining text, image, audio in a single API
  \item
    Examples include OpenAI's GPT-4 Vision, Google's Gemini, Anthropic's
    Claude Opus
  \item
    Allows for more complex interactions like ``describe this image'' or
    ``create an image based on this text''
  \end{itemize}
\end{enumerate}

\hypertarget{integration-models-1}{%
\subsection{Integration Models}\label{integration-models-1}}

When integrating AI services, you'll generally use one of these
patterns:

\begin{enumerate}
\def\labelenumi{\arabic{enumi}.}
\tightlist
\item
  \textbf{REST API Integration}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Making HTTP requests to AI service endpoints
  \item
    Sending data in JSON format and processing JSON responses
  \item
    Managing authentication through API keys or OAuth tokens
  \end{itemize}
\item
  \textbf{SDK-based Integration}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Using official Python libraries provided by AI service vendors
  \item
    Typically wraps the REST API with Python-friendly interfaces
  \item
    Often handles authentication and request formatting
  \end{itemize}
\item
  \textbf{Library-based Integration}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Using third-party Python libraries that abstract away the API
    details
  \item
    May provide higher-level functionality or combine multiple services
  \item
    Examples include LangChain, LlamaIndex, and similar frameworks
  \end{itemize}
\item
  \textbf{Self-hosted Models}

  \begin{itemize}
  \tightlist
  \item
    Running open-source AI models directly in your application
  \item
    Libraries like Hugging Face's Transformers make this possible
  \item
    Requires more computational resources but reduces API costs and
    latency
  \end{itemize}
\end{enumerate}

\hypertarget{secure-authentication-and-api-key-management}{%
\section{7. Secure Authentication and API Key
Management}\label{secure-authentication-and-api-key-management}}

When integrating with AI services, proper handling of API keys and
authentication is crucial.

\hypertarget{using-environment-variables}{%
\subsection{Using Environment
Variables}\label{using-environment-variables}}

The simplest approach is to use environment variables:

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ os}
\ImportTok{from}\NormalTok{ dotenv }\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ load\_dotenv}

\CommentTok{\# Load environment variables from a .env file}
\NormalTok{load\_dotenv()}

\CommentTok{\# Access API keys}
\NormalTok{openai\_api\_key }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ os.environ.get(}\StringTok{"OPENAI\_API\_KEY"}\NormalTok{)}
\NormalTok{azure\_api\_key }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ os.environ.get(}\StringTok{"AZURE\_API\_KEY"}\NormalTok{)}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

You would create a \texttt{.env} file with your keys:

\begin{verbatim}
OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-your-key-here
AZURE_API_KEY=your-azure-key-here
\end{verbatim}

\textbf{Important:} Add \texttt{.env} to your \texttt{.gitignore} file
to avoid accidentally committing API keys.

\hypertarget{secure-key-storage-options}{%
\subsection{Secure Key Storage
Options}\label{secure-key-storage-options}}

For more robust applications, consider:

\begin{enumerate}
\def\labelenumi{\arabic{enumi}.}
\tightlist
\item
  \textbf{Secret management services}: AWS Secrets Manager, Azure Key
  Vault, HashiCorp Vault
\item
  \textbf{Database storage}: Encrypted database fields for API keys
\item
  \textbf{Configuration management}: Tools like Ansible or Chef with
  encryption
\end{enumerate}

Example using AWS Secrets Manager:

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ boto3}
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ json}

\KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ get\_secret(secret\_name, region\_name}\OperatorTok{=}\StringTok{"us{-}west{-}2"}\NormalTok{):}
    \CommentTok{"""Retrieve a secret from AWS Secrets Manager."""}
    \CommentTok{\# Create a Secrets Manager client}
\NormalTok{    session }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ boto3.session.Session()}
\NormalTok{    client }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ session.client(}
\NormalTok{        service\_name}\OperatorTok{=}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}secretsmanager\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{,}
\NormalTok{        region\_name}\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{region\_name}
\NormalTok{    )}

    \ControlFlowTok{try}\NormalTok{:}
        \CommentTok{\# Get the secret value}
\NormalTok{        response }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ client.get\_secret\_value(SecretId}\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{secret\_name)}

        \CommentTok{\# Parse the secret JSON}
        \ControlFlowTok{if} \StringTok{\textquotesingle{}SecretString\textquotesingle{}} \KeywordTok{in}\NormalTok{ response:}
\NormalTok{            secret }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ json.loads(response[}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}SecretString\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{])}
            \ControlFlowTok{return}\NormalTok{ secret}
        \ControlFlowTok{else}\NormalTok{:}
            \CommentTok{\# Binary secrets need to be decoded}
            \ControlFlowTok{return}\NormalTok{ response[}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}SecretBinary\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{]}

    \ControlFlowTok{except} \PreprocessorTok{Exception} \ImportTok{as}\NormalTok{ e:}
        \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"Error retrieving secret: }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{e}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}\NormalTok{)}
        \ControlFlowTok{return} \VariableTok{None}

\CommentTok{\# Usage}
\NormalTok{secrets }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ get\_secret(}\StringTok{"ai{-}service{-}keys"}\NormalTok{)}
\NormalTok{openai\_api\_key }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ secrets.get(}\StringTok{"OPENAI\_API\_KEY"}\NormalTok{)}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\hypertarget{testing-and-troubleshooting-ai-integrations}{%
\section{8. Testing and Troubleshooting AI
Integrations}\label{testing-and-troubleshooting-ai-integrations}}

Testing AI integrations can be challenging due to rate limits, costs,
and the sometimes non-deterministic nature of AI responses.

\hypertarget{creating-test-fixtures-for-ai-apis}{%
\subsection{Creating Test Fixtures for AI
APIs}\label{creating-test-fixtures-for-ai-apis}}

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ unittest}
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ json}
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ os}
\ImportTok{from}\NormalTok{ unittest.mock }\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ patch, MagicMock}

\KeywordTok{class}\NormalTok{ MockResponse:}
    \CommentTok{"""A mock Response object for testing."""}

    \KeywordTok{def} \FunctionTok{\_\_init\_\_}\NormalTok{(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, status\_code, json\_data):}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.status\_code }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ status\_code}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.json\_data }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ json\_data}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.text }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ json.dumps(json\_data)}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ json(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{):}
        \ControlFlowTok{return} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.json\_data}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ raise\_for\_status(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{):}
        \ControlFlowTok{if} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.status\_code }\OperatorTok{\textgreater{}=} \DecValTok{400}\NormalTok{:}
            \ControlFlowTok{raise} \PreprocessorTok{Exception}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"HTTP Error: }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{status\_code}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}\NormalTok{)}

\KeywordTok{class}\NormalTok{ TestOpenAIIntegration(unittest.TestCase):}
    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ setUp(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{\# Load test fixtures}
\NormalTok{        fixture\_path }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ os.path.join(os.path.dirname(}\VariableTok{\_\_file\_\_}\NormalTok{), }\StringTok{"fixtures"}\NormalTok{, }\StringTok{"openai\_response.json"}\NormalTok{)}
        \ControlFlowTok{with} \BuiltInTok{open}\NormalTok{(fixture\_path, }\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}r\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{) }\ImportTok{as}\NormalTok{ f:}
            \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.mock\_openai\_response }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ json.load(f)}

    \AttributeTok{@patch}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}requests.post\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{)}
    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ test\_generate\_text(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, mock\_post):}
        \CommentTok{\# Configure the mock}
\NormalTok{        mock\_post.return\_value }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ MockResponse(}\DecValTok{200}\NormalTok{, }\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.mock\_openai\_response)}

        \CommentTok{\# Import the function to test}
        \ImportTok{from}\NormalTok{ my\_ai\_module }\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ generate\_text}

        \CommentTok{\# Call the function}
\NormalTok{        result }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ generate\_text(}\StringTok{"Test prompt"}\NormalTok{, api\_key}\OperatorTok{=}\StringTok{"fake\_key"}\NormalTok{)}

        \CommentTok{\# Assert the result}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.assertIsNotNone(result)}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.assertIn(}\StringTok{"This is a test response"}\NormalTok{, result)}

        \CommentTok{\# Verify the API was called correctly}
\NormalTok{        mock\_post.assert\_called\_once()}
\NormalTok{        args, kwargs }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ mock\_post.call\_args}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.assertEqual(kwargs[}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}headers\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{][}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}Authorization\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{], }\StringTok{"Bearer fake\_key"}\NormalTok{)}
\NormalTok{        payload }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ json.loads(kwargs[}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}data\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{])}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.assertEqual(payload[}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}messages\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{][}\DecValTok{0}\NormalTok{][}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}content\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{], }\StringTok{"Test prompt"}\NormalTok{)}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\hypertarget{creating-a-test-mode-for-ai-dependent-features}{%
\subsection{Creating a Test Mode for AI-Dependent
Features}\label{creating-a-test-mode-for-ai-dependent-features}}

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\KeywordTok{class}\NormalTok{ AIService:}
    \CommentTok{"""A service that integrates with AI APIs."""}

    \KeywordTok{def} \FunctionTok{\_\_init\_\_}\NormalTok{(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, api\_key}\OperatorTok{=}\VariableTok{None}\NormalTok{, test\_mode}\OperatorTok{=}\VariableTok{False}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{"""}
\CommentTok{        Initialize the AI service.}

\CommentTok{        Args:}
\CommentTok{            api\_key (str, optional): API key for the service}
\CommentTok{            test\_mode (bool): If True, use mock responses instead of real API calls}
\CommentTok{        """}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.api\_key }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ api\_key }\KeywordTok{or}\NormalTok{ os.environ.get(}\StringTok{"OPENAI\_API\_KEY"}\NormalTok{)}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.test\_mode }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ test\_mode}

        \CommentTok{\# Load test responses if in test mode}
        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ test\_mode:}
            \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.\_load\_test\_responses()}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ \_load\_test\_responses(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{"""Load mock responses for test mode."""}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.test\_responses }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ \{}
            \StringTok{"greeting"}\NormalTok{: }\StringTok{"Hello! This is a test response."}\NormalTok{,}
            \StringTok{"question"}\NormalTok{: }\StringTok{"This is a mock answer to your question."}\NormalTok{,}
            \StringTok{"default"}\NormalTok{: }\StringTok{"This is a default test response."}
\NormalTok{        \}}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ get\_completion(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, prompt):}
        \CommentTok{"""}
\CommentTok{        Get a completion from the AI.}

\CommentTok{        Args:}
\CommentTok{            prompt (str): The prompt to send}

\CommentTok{        Returns:}
\CommentTok{            str: The AI\textquotesingle{}s response}
\CommentTok{        """}
        \CommentTok{\# If in test mode, return a mock response}
        \ControlFlowTok{if} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.test\_mode:}
            \ControlFlowTok{if} \StringTok{"hello"} \KeywordTok{in}\NormalTok{ prompt.lower() }\KeywordTok{or} \StringTok{"hi"} \KeywordTok{in}\NormalTok{ prompt.lower():}
                \ControlFlowTok{return} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.test\_responses[}\StringTok{"greeting"}\NormalTok{]}
            \ControlFlowTok{elif} \StringTok{"?"} \KeywordTok{in}\NormalTok{ prompt:}
                \ControlFlowTok{return} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.test\_responses[}\StringTok{"question"}\NormalTok{]}
            \ControlFlowTok{else}\NormalTok{:}
                \ControlFlowTok{return} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.test\_responses[}\StringTok{"default"}\NormalTok{]}

        \CommentTok{\# Otherwise, call the real API}
        \ControlFlowTok{try}\NormalTok{:}
\NormalTok{            openai.api\_key }\OperatorTok{=} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.api\_key}
\NormalTok{            response }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ openai.ChatCompletion.create(}
\NormalTok{                model}\OperatorTok{=}\StringTok{"gpt{-}3.5{-}turbo"}\NormalTok{,}
\NormalTok{                messages}\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{[\{}\StringTok{"role"}\NormalTok{: }\StringTok{"user"}\NormalTok{, }\StringTok{"content"}\NormalTok{: prompt\}],}
\NormalTok{                max\_tokens}\OperatorTok{=}\DecValTok{150}
\NormalTok{            )}
            \ControlFlowTok{return}\NormalTok{ response.choices[}\DecValTok{0}\NormalTok{].message.content.strip()}
        \ControlFlowTok{except} \PreprocessorTok{Exception} \ImportTok{as}\NormalTok{ e:}
            \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"Error calling AI API: }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{e}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}\NormalTok{)}
            \ControlFlowTok{return} \StringTok{"Error: Could not get response from AI service."}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\hypertarget{project-corner-enhancing-your-chatbot-with-ai-1}{%
\section{9. Project Corner: Enhancing Your Chatbot with

\hypertarget{adding-ai-powered-understanding-to-the-chatbot}{%
\subsection{Adding AI-Powered Understanding to the
Chatbot}\label{adding-ai-powered-understanding-to-the-chatbot}}

First, let's create a class that uses AI to better understand user
messages:

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ openai}
\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ os}
\ImportTok{from}\NormalTok{ dotenv }\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ load\_dotenv}

\KeywordTok{class}\NormalTok{ MessageUnderstanding:}
    \CommentTok{"""A class that uses AI to understand user messages."""}

    \KeywordTok{def} \FunctionTok{\_\_init\_\_}\NormalTok{(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, api\_key}\OperatorTok{=}\VariableTok{None}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{\# Load environment variables if needed}
\NormalTok{        load\_dotenv()}

        \CommentTok{\# Set API key}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.api\_key }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ api\_key }\KeywordTok{or}\NormalTok{ os.environ.get(}\StringTok{"OPENAI\_API\_KEY"}\NormalTok{)}
        \ControlFlowTok{if} \KeywordTok{not} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.api\_key:}
            \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"Warning: No OpenAI API key provided. AI features will not work."}\NormalTok{)}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ analyze\_intent(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, message):}
        \CommentTok{"""}
\CommentTok{        Analyze the intent of a user message.}

\CommentTok{        Args:}
\CommentTok{            message (str): The user\textquotesingle{}s message}

\CommentTok{        Returns:}
\CommentTok{            dict: Intent analysis with confidence scores}
\CommentTok{        """}
        \ControlFlowTok{if} \KeywordTok{not} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.api\_key:}
            \ControlFlowTok{return}\NormalTok{ \{}\StringTok{"intent"}\NormalTok{: }\StringTok{"unknown"}\NormalTok{, }\StringTok{"confidence"}\NormalTok{: }\FloatTok{0.0}\NormalTok{\}}

        \ControlFlowTok{try}\NormalTok{:}
            \CommentTok{\# Create the prompt for intent analysis}
\NormalTok{            prompt }\OperatorTok{=} \SpecialStringTok{f"""}
\SpecialStringTok{            Analyze the following message and determine the user\textquotesingle{}s intent.}
\SpecialStringTok{            Return ONLY a JSON object with "intent" and "confidence" fields.}

\SpecialStringTok{            Possible intents: greeting, farewell, question, request, complaint, smalltalk, other}

\SpecialStringTok{            Message: "}\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{message}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}

\SpecialStringTok{            JSON:}
\SpecialStringTok{            """}

            \CommentTok{\# Call the API}
\NormalTok{            openai.api\_key }\OperatorTok{=} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.api\_key}
\NormalTok{            response }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ openai.ChatCompletion.create(}
\NormalTok{                model}\OperatorTok{=}\StringTok{"gpt{-}3.5{-}turbo"}\NormalTok{,}
\NormalTok{                messages}\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{[\{}\StringTok{"role"}\NormalTok{: }\StringTok{"user"}\NormalTok{, }\StringTok{"content"}\NormalTok{: prompt\}],}
\NormalTok{                max\_tokens}\OperatorTok{=}\DecValTok{100}\NormalTok{,}
\NormalTok{                temperature}\OperatorTok{=}\FloatTok{0.3}
\NormalTok{            )}

            \CommentTok{\# Parse the response as JSON}

\NormalTok{            result\_text }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ response.choices[}\DecValTok{0}\NormalTok{].message.content.strip()}

            \CommentTok{\# Handle potential formatting in the response}
            \ControlFlowTok{try}\NormalTok{:}
                \CommentTok{\# Try to parse the raw response}
\NormalTok{                result }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ json.loads(result\_text)}
            \ControlFlowTok{except}\NormalTok{ json.JSONDecodeError:}

                \ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ re}
\NormalTok{                json\_match }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ re.search(}\VerbatimStringTok{r\textquotesingle{}\textbackslash{}\{.*\textbackslash{}\}\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{, result\_text, re.DOTALL)}

\NormalTok{                    result }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ json.loads(json\_match.group(}\DecValTok{0}\NormalTok{))}
                \ControlFlowTok{else}\NormalTok{:}

\NormalTok{            prompt }\OperatorTok{=} \SpecialStringTok{f"""}
\SpecialStringTok{            Extract entities from the following message.}
\SpecialStringTok{            Return ONLY a JSON object where keys are entity types and values are the extracted entities.}

\SpecialStringTok{            Possible entity types: person, location, organization, date\_time, product, quantity, other}

\SpecialStringTok{            Message: "}\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{message}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}

\SpecialStringTok{            JSON:}
\SpecialStringTok{            """}

            \CommentTok{\# Call the API}
\NormalTok{            openai.api\_key }\OperatorTok{=} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.api\_key}
\NormalTok{            response }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ openai.ChatCompletion.create(}
\NormalTok{                model}\OperatorTok{=}\StringTok{"gpt{-}3.5{-}turbo"}\NormalTok{,}
\NormalTok{                messages}\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{[\{}\StringTok{"role"}\NormalTok{: }\StringTok{"user"}\NormalTok{, }\StringTok{"content"}\NormalTok{: prompt\}],}
\NormalTok{                max\_tokens}\OperatorTok{=}\DecValTok{150}\NormalTok{,}
\NormalTok{                temperature}\OperatorTok{=}\FloatTok{0.3}
\NormalTok{            )}

            \CommentTok{\# Parse the response as JSON}
            \ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ json}
\NormalTok{            result\_text }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ response.choices[}\DecValTok{0}\NormalTok{].message.content.strip()}

            \CommentTok{\# Handle potential formatting in the response}

                \CommentTok{\# Try to parse the raw response}
\NormalTok{                result }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ json.loads(result\_text)}
            \ControlFlowTok{except}\NormalTok{ json.JSONDecodeError:}
                \CommentTok{\# If that fails, try to extract JSON from the text}

\NormalTok{                json\_match }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ re.search(}\VerbatimStringTok{r\textquotesingle{}\textbackslash{}\{.*\textbackslash{}\}\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{, result\_text, re.DOTALL)}
                \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ json\_match:}
\NormalTok{                    result }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ json.loads(json\_match.group(}\DecValTok{0}\NormalTok{))}
                \ControlFlowTok{else}\NormalTok{:}
                    \ControlFlowTok{raise} \PreprocessorTok{ValueError}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"Could not parse JSON from response"}\NormalTok{)}

\hypertarget{ai-enhanced-chatbot-implementation}{%
\subsection{AI-Enhanced Chatbot
Implementation}\label{ai-enhanced-chatbot-implementation}}

Now, let's integrate this into our chatbot:

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\KeywordTok{class}\NormalTok{ AIEnhancedChatbot:}
    \CommentTok{"""A chatbot enhanced with AI capabilities."""}

    \KeywordTok{def} \FunctionTok{\_\_init\_\_}\NormalTok{(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, name}\OperatorTok{=}\StringTok{"AI Chatbot"}\NormalTok{, api\_key}\OperatorTok{=}\VariableTok{None}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{"""}
\CommentTok{        Initialize the AI{-}enhanced chatbot.}

\CommentTok{        Args:}
\CommentTok{            name (str): The chatbot\textquotesingle{}s name}
\CommentTok{            api\_key (str, optional): API key for AI services}
\CommentTok{        """}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.name }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ name}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.user\_name }\OperatorTok{=} \VariableTok{None}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.conversation\_history }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ []}

        \CommentTok{\# Initialize AI components}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.message\_understanding }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ MessageUnderstanding(api\_key)}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.conversational\_ai }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ ConversationalAI(}
\NormalTok{            api\_key}\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{api\_key,}
\NormalTok{            system\_prompt}\OperatorTok{=}\SpecialStringTok{f"You are }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{name}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{, a helpful assistant. Keep responses concise and friendly."}
\NormalTok{        )}

        \CommentTok{\# Flag to control AI usage}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.use\_ai }\OperatorTok{=} \VariableTok{True}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ greet(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{"""Greet the user and get their name."""}
        \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"Hello! I\textquotesingle{}m }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{name}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{, an AI{-}enhanced chatbot. Type \textquotesingle{}bye\textquotesingle{} to exit."}\NormalTok{)}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.user\_name }\OperatorTok{=} \BuiltInTok{input}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"What\textquotesingle{}s your name? "}\NormalTok{)}
        \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"Nice to meet you, }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{user\_name}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{!"}\NormalTok{)}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.add\_to\_history(}\StringTok{"SYSTEM"}\NormalTok{, }\SpecialStringTok{f"Conversation started with }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{user\_name}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}\NormalTok{)}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ add\_to\_history(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, speaker, text):}
        \CommentTok{"""Add a message to the conversation history."""}
        \ImportTok{from}\NormalTok{ datetime }\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ datetime}
\NormalTok{        timestamp }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ datetime.now().strftime(}\StringTok{"\%H:\%M:\%S"}\NormalTok{)}
\NormalTok{        entry }\OperatorTok{=} \SpecialStringTok{f"[}\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{timestamp}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{] }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{speaker}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{: }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{text}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.conversation\_history.append(entry)}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ get\_response(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, user\_input):}
        \CommentTok{"""Generate a response to the user input using AI capabilities."""}
        \CommentTok{\# Handle special commands}
        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ user\_input.lower() }\OperatorTok{==} \StringTok{"help"}\NormalTok{:}
            \ControlFlowTok{return} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.get\_help()}
        \ControlFlowTok{elif}\NormalTok{ user\_input.lower() }\OperatorTok{==} \StringTok{"history"}\NormalTok{:}
            \ControlFlowTok{return} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.show\_history()}
        \ControlFlowTok{elif}\NormalTok{ user\_input.lower() }\OperatorTok{==} \StringTok{"toggle ai"}\NormalTok{:}
            \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.use\_ai }\OperatorTok{=} \KeywordTok{not} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.use\_ai}
            \ControlFlowTok{return} \SpecialStringTok{f"AI features turned }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}on\textquotesingle{}} \ControlFlowTok{if} \VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{use\_ai }\ControlFlowTok{else} \StringTok{\textquotesingle{}off\textquotesingle{}}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}

        \ControlFlowTok{if} \KeywordTok{not} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.use\_ai:}
            \CommentTok{\# Fall back to rule{-}based response if AI is disabled}
            \ControlFlowTok{return} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.get\_rule\_based\_response(user\_input)}

        \ControlFlowTok{try}\NormalTok{:}
            \CommentTok{\# Use AI to understand the message}
\NormalTok{            intent\_analysis }\OperatorTok{=} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.message\_understanding.analyze\_intent(user\_input)}
\NormalTok{            entities }\OperatorTok{=} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.message\_understanding.extract\_entities(user\_input)}

            \CommentTok{\# Log the understanding (in a real system, you might not show this to the user)}
\NormalTok{            understanding\_log }\OperatorTok{=} \SpecialStringTok{f"Intent: }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{intent\_analysis}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{get(}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}intent\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{, }\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}unknown\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{)}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{ (}\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{intent\_analysis}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{get(}\StringTok{\textquotesingle{}confidence\textquotesingle{}}\NormalTok{, }\DecValTok{0}\NormalTok{)}\SpecialCharTok{:.2f\}}\SpecialStringTok{)"}
            \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ entities:}
\NormalTok{                understanding\_log }\OperatorTok{+=} \SpecialStringTok{f", Entities: }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{entities}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}
            \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.add\_to\_history(}\StringTok{"SYSTEM"}\NormalTok{, understanding\_log)}

            \CommentTok{\# Get a response from the conversational AI}
\NormalTok{            ai\_response }\OperatorTok{=} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.conversational\_ai.get\_response(user\_input)}

            \ControlFlowTok{return}\NormalTok{ ai\_response}

        \ControlFlowTok{except} \PreprocessorTok{Exception} \ImportTok{as}\NormalTok{ e:}
            \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"Error in AI processing: }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{e}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}\NormalTok{)}
            \CommentTok{\# Fall back to rule{-}based response if AI fails}
            \ControlFlowTok{return} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.get\_rule\_based\_response(user\_input)}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ get\_rule\_based\_response(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, user\_input):}
        \CommentTok{"""Generate a response using simple rule{-}based patterns."""}
\NormalTok{        user\_input }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ user\_input.lower()}

        \ControlFlowTok{if} \StringTok{"hello"} \KeywordTok{in}\NormalTok{ user\_input }\KeywordTok{or} \StringTok{"hi"} \KeywordTok{in}\NormalTok{ user\_input:}
            \ControlFlowTok{return} \SpecialStringTok{f"Hello, }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{user\_name}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{! How can I help you today?"}
        \ControlFlowTok{elif} \StringTok{"how are you"} \KeywordTok{in}\NormalTok{ user\_input:}
            \ControlFlowTok{return} \StringTok{"I\textquotesingle{}m doing well, thank you for asking!"}
        \ControlFlowTok{elif} \StringTok{"your name"} \KeywordTok{in}\NormalTok{ user\_input:}
            \ControlFlowTok{return} \SpecialStringTok{f"My name is }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{name}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{. I\textquotesingle{}m an AI{-}enhanced chatbot."}
        \ControlFlowTok{elif} \StringTok{"bye"} \KeywordTok{in}\NormalTok{ user\_input }\KeywordTok{or} \StringTok{"goodbye"} \KeywordTok{in}\NormalTok{ user\_input:}
            \ControlFlowTok{return} \SpecialStringTok{f"Goodbye, }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{user\_name}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{! It was nice chatting with you."}
        \ControlFlowTok{else}\NormalTok{:}
            \ControlFlowTok{return} \StringTok{"I\textquotesingle{}m not sure how to respond to that. Can you try asking something else?"}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ show\_history(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{"""Show the conversation history."""}
        \ControlFlowTok{if} \KeywordTok{not} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.conversation\_history:}
            \ControlFlowTok{return} \StringTok{"No conversation history yet."}

\NormalTok{        history }\OperatorTok{=} \StringTok{"}\CharTok{\textbackslash{}n}\StringTok{{-}{-}{-}{-}{-} Conversation History {-}{-}{-}{-}{-}}\CharTok{\textbackslash{}n}\StringTok{"}
        \ControlFlowTok{for}\NormalTok{ entry }\KeywordTok{in} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.conversation\_history:}
\NormalTok{            history }\OperatorTok{+=} \SpecialStringTok{f"}\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{entry}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\CharTok{\textbackslash{}n}\SpecialStringTok{"}
\NormalTok{        history }\OperatorTok{+=} \StringTok{"{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}{-}"}
        \ControlFlowTok{return}\NormalTok{ history}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ get\_help(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{"""Get help information."""}
\NormalTok{        help\_text }\OperatorTok{=} \SpecialStringTok{f"""}
\SpecialStringTok{Available Commands:}
\SpecialStringTok{{-} \textquotesingle{}help\textquotesingle{}: Display this help message}
\SpecialStringTok{{-} \textquotesingle{}history\textquotesingle{}: Show conversation history}
\SpecialStringTok{{-} \textquotesingle{}toggle ai\textquotesingle{}: Turn AI features on/off}
\SpecialStringTok{{-} \textquotesingle{}bye\textquotesingle{}: End the conversation}

\SpecialStringTok{You can also just chat with me normally, }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{user\_name}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{!}
\SpecialStringTok{"""}
        \ControlFlowTok{return}\NormalTok{ help\_text}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ run(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{"""Run the main chatbot loop."""}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.greet()}

        \ControlFlowTok{while} \VariableTok{True}\NormalTok{:}
\NormalTok{            user\_input }\OperatorTok{=} \BuiltInTok{input}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"}\SpecialCharTok{\{}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{user\_name}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{\textgreater{} "}\NormalTok{)}
            \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.add\_to\_history(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.user\_name, user\_input)}

            \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ user\_input.lower() }\OperatorTok{==} \StringTok{"bye"}\NormalTok{:}
\NormalTok{                response }\OperatorTok{=} \SpecialStringTok{f"Goodbye, }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{user\_name}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{! I hope to chat again soon."}
                \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"}\SpecialCharTok{\{}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{name}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{\textgreater{} }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{response}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}\NormalTok{)}
                \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.add\_to\_history(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.name, response)}
                \ControlFlowTok{break}

\NormalTok{            response }\OperatorTok{=} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.get\_response(user\_input)}
            \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"}\SpecialCharTok{\{}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{name}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{\textgreater{} }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{response}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}\NormalTok{)}
            \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.add\_to\_history(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.name, response)}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\hypertarget{running-the-ai-enhanced-chatbot}{%
\subsection{Running the AI-Enhanced
Chatbot}\label{running-the-ai-enhanced-chatbot}}

Here's how you might run the AI-enhanced chatbot:

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\ControlFlowTok{if} \VariableTok{\_\_name\_\_} \OperatorTok{==} \StringTok{"\_\_main\_\_"}\NormalTok{:}
    \CommentTok{\# Import necessary modules}
    \ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ os}
    \ImportTok{from}\NormalTok{ dotenv }\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ load\_dotenv}

    \CommentTok{\# Load environment variables}
\NormalTok{    load\_dotenv()}

    \CommentTok{\# Get API key from environment}
\NormalTok{    api\_key }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ os.environ.get(}\StringTok{"OPENAI\_API\_KEY"}\NormalTok{)}

    \CommentTok{\# Check if API key is available}
    \ControlFlowTok{if} \KeywordTok{not}\NormalTok{ api\_key:}
        \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"Warning: No OpenAI API key found in environment variables."}\NormalTok{)}
        \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"The chatbot will run with limited AI capabilities."}\NormalTok{)}

        \CommentTok{\# Ask if user wants to proceed}
\NormalTok{        proceed }\OperatorTok{=} \BuiltInTok{input}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"Do you want to continue without AI features? (y/n): "}\NormalTok{)}
        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ proceed.lower() }\OperatorTok{!=} \StringTok{"y"}\NormalTok{:}
            \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\StringTok{"Exiting. Please set up an API key in a .env file to use AI features."}\NormalTok{)}
\NormalTok{            exit()}

    \CommentTok{\# Create and run the chatbot}
\NormalTok{    chatbot }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ AIEnhancedChatbot(name}\OperatorTok{=}\StringTok{"AIBot"}\NormalTok{, api\_key}\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{api\_key)}
\NormalTok{    chatbot.run()}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\hypertarget{handling-api-costs-and-rate-limits}{%
\section{10. Handling API Costs and Rate
Limits}\label{handling-api-costs-and-rate-limits}}

When using AI services in your chatbot, it's important to be mindful of
costs and rate limits:

\begin{enumerate}
\def\labelenumi{\arabic{enumi}.}
\tightlist
\item
  \textbf{Track usage}: Implement a counter for API calls and log costs
\item
  \textbf{Set limits}: Define maximum daily/monthly usage thresholds
\item
  \textbf{Cache responses}: Store responses for common queries
\item
  \textbf{Use fallbacks}: Implement rule-based responses as fallbacks
\item
  \textbf{Tier your approach}: Use cheaper AI services for routine
  tasks, reserve expensive ones for complex queries
\end{enumerate}

Here's an example of a cost-tracking wrapper:

\begin{Shaded}
\begin{Highlighting}[]
\KeywordTok{class}\NormalTok{ CostTrackingAI:}
    \CommentTok{"""A wrapper for AI services that tracks usage and costs."""}

    \KeywordTok{def} \FunctionTok{\_\_init\_\_}\NormalTok{(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, api\_key, cost\_per\_1k\_tokens}\OperatorTok{=}\FloatTok{0.002}\NormalTok{, daily\_budget}\OperatorTok{=}\FloatTok{1.0}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{"""}
\CommentTok{        Initialize the cost tracking AI wrapper.}

\CommentTok{        Args:}
\CommentTok{            api\_key (str): API key for the service}
\CommentTok{            cost\_per\_1k\_tokens (float): Cost per 1000 tokens in USD}
\CommentTok{            daily\_budget (float): Maximum daily budget in USD}
\CommentTok{        """}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.api\_key }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ api\_key}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.cost\_per\_1k\_tokens }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ cost\_per\_1k\_tokens}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.daily\_budget }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ daily\_budget}

        \CommentTok{\# Initialize usage tracking}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.tokens\_used\_today }\OperatorTok{=} \DecValTok{0}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.requests\_made\_today }\OperatorTok{=} \DecValTok{0}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.estimated\_cost\_today }\OperatorTok{=} \FloatTok{0.0}

        \CommentTok{\# Initialize the OpenAI client}
\NormalTok{        openai.api\_key }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ api\_key}

        \CommentTok{\# Set the date for tracking}
        \ImportTok{from}\NormalTok{ datetime }\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ date}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.current\_date }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ date.today()}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ \_update\_date(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{"""Update the current date and reset counters if needed."""}
        \ImportTok{from}\NormalTok{ datetime }\ImportTok{import}\NormalTok{ date}
\NormalTok{        today }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ date.today()}

        \ControlFlowTok{if}\NormalTok{ today }\OperatorTok{\textgreater{}} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.current\_date:}
            \CommentTok{\# It\textquotesingle{}s a new day, reset counters}
            \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.current\_date }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ today}
            \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.tokens\_used\_today }\OperatorTok{=} \DecValTok{0}
            \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.requests\_made\_today }\OperatorTok{=} \DecValTok{0}
            \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.estimated\_cost\_today }\OperatorTok{=} \FloatTok{0.0}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ \_update\_usage(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, tokens\_used):}
        \CommentTok{"""}
\CommentTok{        Update usage statistics.}

\CommentTok{        Args:}
\CommentTok{            tokens\_used (int): Number of tokens used in the request}
\CommentTok{        """}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.\_update\_date()}

        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.tokens\_used\_today }\OperatorTok{+=}\NormalTok{ tokens\_used}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.requests\_made\_today }\OperatorTok{+=} \DecValTok{1}

        \CommentTok{\# Calculate cost}
\NormalTok{        cost }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ (tokens\_used }\OperatorTok{/} \DecValTok{1000}\NormalTok{) }\OperatorTok{*} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.cost\_per\_1k\_tokens}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.estimated\_cost\_today }\OperatorTok{+=}\NormalTok{ cost}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ can\_make\_request(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, estimated\_tokens}\OperatorTok{=}\DecValTok{500}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{"""}
\CommentTok{        Check if a request can be made within budget constraints.}

\CommentTok{        Args:}
\CommentTok{            estimated\_tokens (int): Estimated tokens for the request}

\CommentTok{        Returns:}
\CommentTok{            bool: True if the request can be made, False otherwise}
\CommentTok{        """}
        \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.\_update\_date()}

        \CommentTok{\# Estimate cost of this request}
\NormalTok{        estimated\_cost }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ (estimated\_tokens }\OperatorTok{/} \DecValTok{1000}\NormalTok{) }\OperatorTok{*} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.cost\_per\_1k\_tokens}

        \CommentTok{\# Check if it would exceed the budget}
        \ControlFlowTok{return}\NormalTok{ (}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.estimated\_cost\_today }\OperatorTok{+}\NormalTok{ estimated\_cost) }\OperatorTok{\textless{}=} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.daily\_budget}

    \KeywordTok{def}\NormalTok{ get\_completion(}\VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{, prompt, max\_tokens}\OperatorTok{=}\DecValTok{150}\NormalTok{):}
        \CommentTok{"""}
\CommentTok{        Get a completion from the AI while tracking costs.}

\CommentTok{        Args:}
\CommentTok{            prompt (str): The prompt to send}
\CommentTok{            max\_tokens (int): Maximum tokens in the response}

\CommentTok{        Returns:}
\CommentTok{            str: The AI\textquotesingle{}s response}
\CommentTok{        """}
        \CommentTok{\# Check if we can make the request}
        \ControlFlowTok{if} \KeywordTok{not} \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.can\_make\_request(estimated\_tokens}\OperatorTok{=}\BuiltInTok{len}\NormalTok{(prompt.split()) }\OperatorTok{+}\NormalTok{ max\_tokens):}
            \ControlFlowTok{return} \StringTok{"I\textquotesingle{}m sorry, I\textquotesingle{}ve reached my usage limit for today. Please try again tomorrow."}

        \ControlFlowTok{try}\NormalTok{:}
            \CommentTok{\# Make the API call}
\NormalTok{            response }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ openai.ChatCompletion.create(}
\NormalTok{                model}\OperatorTok{=}\StringTok{"gpt{-}3.5{-}turbo"}\NormalTok{,}
\NormalTok{                messages}\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{[\{}\StringTok{"role"}\NormalTok{: }\StringTok{"user"}\NormalTok{, }\StringTok{"content"}\NormalTok{: prompt\}],}
\NormalTok{                max\_tokens}\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{max\_tokens}
\NormalTok{            )}

            \CommentTok{\# Update usage tracking}
\NormalTok{            prompt\_tokens }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ response.usage.prompt\_tokens}
\NormalTok{            completion\_tokens }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ response.usage.completion\_tokens}
\NormalTok{            total\_tokens }\OperatorTok{=}\NormalTok{ response.usage.total\_tokens}
            \VariableTok{self}\NormalTok{.\_update\_usage(total\_tokens)}

            \CommentTok{\# Log usage}
            \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"Request used }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{total\_tokens}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{ tokens ($}\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{(total\_tokens}\OperatorTok{/}\DecValTok{1000}\NormalTok{)}\OperatorTok{*}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{cost\_per\_1k\_tokens}\SpecialCharTok{:.6f\}}\SpecialStringTok{)"}\NormalTok{)}
            \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"Daily usage: }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{tokens\_used\_today}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{ tokens, Est. cost: $}\SpecialCharTok{\{}\VariableTok{self}\SpecialCharTok{.}\NormalTok{estimated\_cost\_today}\SpecialCharTok{:.4f\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}\NormalTok{)}

            \ControlFlowTok{return}\NormalTok{ response.choices[}\DecValTok{0}\NormalTok{].message.content.strip()}

        \ControlFlowTok{except} \PreprocessorTok{Exception} \ImportTok{as}\NormalTok{ e:}
            \BuiltInTok{print}\NormalTok{(}\SpecialStringTok{f"Error in AI request: }\SpecialCharTok{\{}\NormalTok{e}\SpecialCharTok{\}}\SpecialStringTok{"}\NormalTok{)}
            \ControlFlowTok{return} \StringTok{"Sorry, I encountered an error processing your request."}
\end{Highlighting}
\end{Shaded}

\textbf{\emph{AI Tip: When integrating AI APIs with Python, follow the
``graceful degradation'' pattern - design your system to work in a
reduced capacity when AI services are unavailable or when rate limits
are reached. This ensures your application remains functional even when
AI services are temporarily inaccessible.}}

\hypertarget{summary-14}{%
\section{Summary}\label{summary-14}}

In this chapter, we've explored how to integrate AI capabilities into
Python applications:

\begin{enumerate}
\def\labelenumi{\arabic{enumi}.}
\item
  We began by understanding the landscape of AI services available for
  Python integration, from LLMs to vision and speech processing.
\item
  We learned how to make direct API calls to AI services using Python's
  requests library, and how to use specialized SDKs for more convenient
  integration.
\item
  We implemented various text processing capabilities, including
  sentiment analysis, named entity recognition, and text summarization.
\item
  We built conversational AI features, both stateless and with
  conversation memory, to enable more natural interactions.
\item
  We covered important practical considerations, including API
  authentication, testing strategies, and cost management.
\item
  Finally, we applied these techniques to enhance our chatbot project
  with AI capabilities, making it more intelligent and helpful.
\end{enumerate}

As AI services continue to evolve and become more accessible, the
ability to integrate them into Python applications will be an
increasingly valuable skill. By understanding the patterns and practices
covered in this chapter, you're well-equipped to build applications that
leverage the power of AI, even without deep expertise in machine
learning or data science.

Remember that integrating external AI services involves trade-offs in
terms of cost, privacy, and dependence on third-party systems. Always
consider these factors when deciding whether and how to incorporate AI
into your Python projects.

Customize AI-generated code to align with your style and project
